Class MathKit

public class MathKit extends Object
Utilities for math.

    • intValue

      public static int intValue(long value)
      Returns the integer value of the long value. If the long value > Integer.MAX_VALUE, returns Integer.MAX_VALUE; else if the long value < Integer.MIN_VALUE, returns Integer.MIN_VALUE; otherwise, returns the long value itself.
      Parameters:
      value - the long value
      Returns:
      the integer value of the long value

    • portionNum

      public static int portionNum(int total, int size)
      Returns the portion number for total / size, it is equivalent to: 
      
 return total % size == 0 ? total / size : total / size + 1;
      Parameters:
      total - the total
      size - the size
      Returns:
      the portion number for total / size

    • portionNum

      public static long portionNum(long total, long size)
      Returns the portion number for total / size, it is equivalent to: 
      
 return total % size == 0 ? total / size : total / size + 1;
      Parameters:
      total - the total
      size - the size
      Returns:
      the portion number for total / size

    • makeIn

      public static int makeIn(int value, int startInclusive, int endExclusive)
      If value <= startInclusive, returns the startInclusive; else if value >= endExclusive, returns endExclusive - 1. It is equivalent to: 
      
 if (value <= startInclusive) {
     return startInclusive;
 }
 if (value >= endExclusive) {
     return endExclusive - 1;
 }
 return value;
      Parameters:
      value - the value
      startInclusive - the start value inclusive
      endExclusive - the end value exclusive
      Returns:
      a value in the range: startInclusive <= value < endExclusive

    • makeIn

      public static long makeIn(long value, long startInclusive, long endExclusive)
      If value <= startInclusive, returns the startInclusive; else if value >= endExclusive, returns endExclusive - 1. It is equivalent to: 
      
 if (value <= startInclusive) {
     return startInclusive;
 }
 if (value >= endExclusive) {
     return endExclusive - 1;
 }
 return value;
      Parameters:
      value - the value
      startInclusive - the start value inclusive
      endExclusive - the end value exclusive
      Returns:
      a value in the range: startInclusive <= value < endExclusive

    • makeIn

      public static float makeIn(float value, float startInclusive, float endExclusive)
      If value <= startInclusive, returns the startInclusive; else if value >= endExclusive, returns Math.nextDown(float) for the endExclusive. It is equivalent to: 
      
 if (value <= startInclusive) {
     return startInclusive;
 }
 if (value >= endExclusive) {
     return Math.nextDown(endExclusive);
 }
 return value;
      Parameters:
      value - the value
      startInclusive - the start value inclusive
      endExclusive - the end value exclusive
      Returns:
      a value in the range: startInclusive <= value < endExclusive

    • makeIn

      public static double makeIn(double value, double startInclusive, double endExclusive)
      If value <= startInclusive, returns the startInclusive; else if value >= endExclusive, returns Math.nextDown(float) for the endExclusive. It is equivalent to: 
      
 if (value <= startInclusive) {
     return startInclusive;
 }
 if (value >= endExclusive) {
     return Math.nextDown(endExclusive);
 }
 return value;
      Parameters:
      value - the value
      startInclusive - the start value inclusive
      endExclusive - the end value exclusive
      Returns:
      a value in the range: startInclusive <= value < endExclusive
